title: Treasury Wines chairman shows the faith
text:
Treasury Wine Estates chairman Paul Rayner has topped up his holdings in the Penfolds owner in a symbolic show of faith after a share price plunge triggered by the departure announcement for chief executive Mike Clarke.

Mr Rayner added to his holding in the company on October 22 with an acquisition of almost $300,000 worth of shares by a personal investment company and personal superannuation funds, at an average price of $16.98.

A filing to the ASX on Wednesday outlined the purchases by Mr Rayner of 6,400 shares by a personal investment company, and 11,185 by a personal superannuation fund, taking his overall combined holding to 297,819 shares worth a combined $5.1 million.

Treasury Wine shares plunged by 12.6 per cent on Monday after Mr Clarke announced he would retire in September 2020 to spend more time with his family in Britain, including his ailing parents.

Treasury Wines chairman Paul Rayner Josh Robenstone

Chief operating officer Tim Ford will succeed Mr Clarke next year. Mr Clarke has been retained for at least one extra year as an adviser, with a special focus on mergers and acquisitions.
description: Paul Rayner, chairman of Treasury Wine, topped up his own holdings after a share price plunge on news of the CEO's exit.
